speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE V. Elsinore. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I will not speak with her.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: She is importunate, indeed distract:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Her mood will needs be pitied.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What would she have?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: She speaks much of her father; says she hears

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: There's tricks i' the world; and hems, and beats her heart;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Spurns enviously at straws; speaks things in doubt,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That carry but half sense: her speech is nothing,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Yet the unshaped use of it doth move

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The hearers to collection; they aim at it,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And botch the words up fit to their own thoughts;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which, as her winks, and nods, and gestures

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: yield them,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Indeed would make one think there might be thought,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Though nothing sure, yet much unhappily.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: 'Twere good she were spoken with; for she may strew

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Dangerous conjectures in ill-breeding minds.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Let her come in.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Exit HORATIO

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To my sick soul, as sin's true nature is,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Each toy seems prologue to some great amiss:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: So full of artless jealousy is guilt,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: It spills itself in fearing to be spilt.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Re-enter HORATIO, with OPHELIA

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Where is the beauteous majesty of Denmark?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: How now, Ophelia!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: How should I your true love know

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: From another one?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By his cockle hat and staff,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And his sandal shoon.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, sweet lady, what imports this song?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Say you? nay, pray you, mark.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is dead and gone, lady,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is dead and gone;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: At his head a grass-green turf,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: At his heels a stone.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nay, but, Ophelia,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Pray you, mark.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: White his shroud as the mountain snow,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, look here, my lord.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Larded with sweet flowers

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Which bewept to the grave did go

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: With true-love showers.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How do you, pretty lady?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Well, God 'ild you! They say the owl was a baker's

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: daughter. Lord, we know what we are, but know not

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: what we may be. God be at your table!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Conceit upon her father.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Pray you, let's have no words of this; but when they

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: ask you what it means, say you this:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: To-morrow is Saint Valentine's day,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: All in the morning betime,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And I a maid at your window,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: To be your Valentine.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Then up he rose, and donn'd his clothes,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And dupp'd the chamber-door;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Let in the maid, that out a maid

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Never departed more.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Pretty Ophelia!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Indeed, la, without an oath, I'll make an end on't:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By Gis and by Saint Charity,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Alack, and fie for shame!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Young men will do't, if they come to't;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: By cock, they are to blame.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Quoth she, before you tumbled me,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You promised me to wed.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: So would I ha' done, by yonder sun,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: An thou hadst not come to my bed.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How long hath she been thus?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: I hope all will be well. We must be patient: but I

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: cannot choose but weep, to think they should lay him

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: i' the cold ground. My brother shall know of it:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: and so I thank you for your good counsel. Come, my

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: coach! Good night, ladies; good night, sweet ladies;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: good night, good night.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Follow her close; give her good watch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I pray you.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit HORATIO

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, this is the poison of deep grief; it springs

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: All from her father's death. O Gertrude, Gertrude,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: When sorrows come, they come not single spies

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But in battalions. First, her father slain:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Next, your son gone; and he most violent author

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of his own just remove: the people muddied,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thick and unwholesome in their thoughts and whispers,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For good Polonius' death; and we have done but greenly,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In hugger-mugger to inter him: poor Ophelia

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Divided from herself and her fair judgment,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Without the which we are pictures, or mere beasts:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Last, and as much containing as all these,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Her brother is in secret come from France;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Feeds on his wonder, keeps himself in clouds,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And wants not buzzers to infect his ear

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With pestilent speeches of his father's death;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Wherein necessity, of matter beggar'd,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will nothing stick our person to arraign

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In ear and ear. O my dear Gertrude, this,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Like to a murdering-piece, in many places

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Gives me superfluous death.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A noise within

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alack, what noise is this?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Where are my Switzers? Let them guard the door.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter another Gentleman

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What is the matter?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Save yourself, my lord:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The ocean, overpeering of his list,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Eats not the flats with more impetuous haste

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Than young Laertes, in a riotous head,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: O'erbears your officers. The rabble call him lord;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And, as the world were now but to begin,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Antiquity forgot, custom not known,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The ratifiers and props of every word,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: They cry 'Choose we: Laertes shall be king:'

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Caps, hands, and tongues, applaud it to the clouds:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: 'Laertes shall be king, Laertes king!'

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: How cheerfully on the false trail they cry!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, this is counter, you false Danish dogs!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The doors are broke.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Noise within

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter LAERTES, armed; Danes following

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Where is this king? Sirs, stand you all without.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: No, let's come in.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I pray you, give me leave.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: We will, we will.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: They retire without the door

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I thank you: keep the door. O thou vile king,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Give me my father!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Calmly, good Laertes.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That drop of blood that's calm proclaims me bastard,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Cries cuckold to my father, brands the harlot

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Even here, between the chaste unsmirched brow

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Of my true mother.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What is the cause, Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That thy rebellion looks so giant-like?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let him go, Gertrude; do not fear our person:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There's such divinity doth hedge a king,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That treason can but peep to what it would,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Acts little of his will. Tell me, Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Why thou art thus incensed. Let him go, Gertrude.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Speak, man.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Where is my father?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Dead.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: But not by him.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let him demand his fill.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: How came he dead? I'll not be juggled with:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To hell, allegiance! vows, to the blackest devil!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Conscience and grace, to the profoundest pit!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I dare damnation. To this point I stand,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That both the worlds I give to negligence,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Let come what comes; only I'll be revenged

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Most thoroughly for my father.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Who shall stay you?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: My will, not all the world:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And for my means, I'll husband them so well,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: They shall go far with little.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Good Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If you desire to know the certainty

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of your dear father's death, is't writ in your revenge,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That, swoopstake, you will draw both friend and foe,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Winner and loser?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: None but his enemies.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will you know them then?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To his good friends thus wide I'll ope my arms;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And like the kind life-rendering pelican,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Repast them with my blood.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Why, now you speak

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Like a good child and a true gentleman.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That I am guiltless of your father's death,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And am most sensible in grief for it,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It shall as level to your judgment pierce

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As day does to your eye.

speaker: Danes
text_entry: [Within]                Let her come in.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: How now! what noise is that?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Re-enter OPHELIA

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: O heat, dry up my brains! tears seven times salt,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Burn out the sense and virtue of mine eye!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: By heaven, thy madness shall be paid by weight,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Till our scale turn the beam. O rose of May!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Dear maid, kind sister, sweet Ophelia!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: O heavens! is't possible, a young maid's wits

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Should be as moral as an old man's life?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Nature is fine in love, and where 'tis fine,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It sends some precious instance of itself

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: After the thing it loves.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: They bore him barefaced on the bier;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Hey non nonny, nonny, hey nonny;

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And in his grave rain'd many a tear:--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Fare you well, my dove!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Hadst thou thy wits, and didst persuade revenge,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It could not move thus.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: You must sing a-down a-down,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: An you call him a-down-a.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: O, how the wheel becomes it! It is the false

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: steward, that stole his master's daughter.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: This nothing's more than matter.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: There's rosemary, that's for remembrance; pray,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: love, remember: and there is pansies. that's for thoughts.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: A document in madness, thoughts and remembrance fitted.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: There's fennel for you, and columbines: there's rue

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: for you; and here's some for me: we may call it

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: herb-grace o' Sundays: O you must wear your rue with

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: a difference. There's a daisy: I would give you

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: some violets, but they withered all when my father

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: died: they say he made a good end,--

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Sings

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: For bonny sweet Robin is all my joy.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Thought and affliction, passion, hell itself,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: She turns to favour and to prettiness.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And will he not come again?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And will he not come again?

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: No, no, he is dead:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Go to thy death-bed:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He never will come again.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: His beard was as white as snow,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: All flaxen was his poll:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: He is gone, he is gone,

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And we cast away moan:

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: God ha' mercy on his soul!

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi' ye.

speaker: OPHELIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Do you see this, O God?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Laertes, I must commune with your grief,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or you deny me right. Go but apart,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If by direct or by collateral hand

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To you in satisfaction; but if not,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Be you content to lend your patience to us,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And we shall jointly labour with your soul

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To give it due content.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Let this be so;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: His means of death, his obscure funeral--

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o'er his bones,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No noble rite nor formal ostentation--

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Cry to be heard, as 'twere from heaven to earth,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That I must call't in question.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: So you shall;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And where the offence is let the great axe fall.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I pray you, go with me.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
